## What is science, really?

::: {.incremental}
- a **stock of accumulated knowledge** (facts & findings)
- a set of **characteristic methods**

- a **set of cultural values** [@Merton1973-vf, p. 268]
:::

## But lawful...

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="45%"}
- [Fitts law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fitts%27s_law)
- aka, speed/accuracy tradeoff
:::
::: {.column width="10%"}
:::
::: {.column width="45%"}
- [Stevens' power law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stevens%27s_power_law)
- aka, non-linear relationship between perceived magnitude and physical magnitude
:::
::::

## Sometimes full of (f)laws

- Cognition is often [systematically biased](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cognitive_biases).
- Most current data are from WEIRD people [@Henrich2010-gf]
- Knowing what is and or is not a robust finding is *harder than it should be*
